result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael K. Fermanich

records.addlTxt:
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. 
No possession of dangerous weapons.

Court calls @ 2:29 PM/ RM 301, 22CF168, 22CF169, 22CF215, 22CF209 & 22CM88. Defendant Michael K. Fermanich appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. In 22CF209 & 22CF215, Def. has copies of complaints, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. Def. will be applying with the PD Office and does wish for counsel. State notes Def. previous non appearance for P.H. on 22CF168 & 22CF169 and notes Def. is not on any supervision currently. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests a $25,000.00 cash bond, to cover 22CF168, 22CF169, 22CF215 & 22CF209 with conditions of No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and No possession of dangerous weapons. State requests 22CM88 to be set for status conference and track along with other cases. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court questions Def. residence and employment. Def. responds. Court considers bail bond factors and orders a $25,000.00 cash bond, to cover 22CF168, 22CF169, 22CF215 & 22CF209, with conditions of No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and No possession of dangerous weapons.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court calls @ 1:22 PM/ RM 203, 22CF168 & 22CF169. Defendant Michael K. Fermanich not in court.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests warrant in both cases for body only Nationwide. State notes Def. has another active warrant and pending charges. State moves to forfeit bonds posted in both cases. Court orders bonds forfeited in both cases pending bail bond forfeiture hearing and authorizes warrant for body only in each case, Nationwide.

Court calls @ 2:28 PM/RM 301, 22CF168, 22CF169 and 22CM88. Defendant Michael K. Fermanich in court.  Attorney Kelly Hays in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history's. Def. has contacted PD Office and is still waiting for counsel. Court advises Def. of right to have P.H. within 20 days and questions if Def. would like to have P.H. within time limits. Def. confirms. Bond continues.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
Maintain Absolute Sobriety. 
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105.

Court calls @ 1:02 PM 22CF169, 22CF168 & 22CM88. Defendant Michael K. Fermanich appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. 22CM88, Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. given Atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed Atty. or represent self. 22CF168, Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. 22CF169, Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties. Def. does wish for an Atty. Court discusses active warrants and quashes warrants. State gives bail bond recommendations and requests on 22CM88, $150.00 cash bond to continue with conditions to Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. State notes Def. prior record and notes concern in Def. behavior in 22CM88. Court questions if there is a victim in cases. State has complied with victim rights. Def. gives bail bond argument. Court questions Def. employment. State corrects record on Def. criminal history. Court considers bail bond factors and orders $1,000.00 cash bond with conditions of No driving a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license, No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and Defendant to apply with Public Defender within 7 days at 715-536-9105. 20CM88, $150.00 cash bond with same conditions and felony cases will be same bond as stated above.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Warrant canceled with Lang. Co. Jail - 1:15 p.m. - J.W.
